functions.title: Identify-P
functions.description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.

functions.title: Govern-P
functions.description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization's risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.

functions.title: Control-P
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.

functions.title: Communicate-P
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.

functions.title: Protect-P
functions.description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

categories.title: Inventory and Mapping
categories.description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.

categories.title: Business Environment
categories.description: The organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

categories.title: Risk Assessment
categories.description: The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities, reputation, workforce, and culture.

categories.title: Policy
categories.description: Organizational privacy values, policies, and training are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.

categories.title: Risk Management Strategy
categories.description: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk.

categories.title: Awareness and Training
categories.description: The organization's workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

categories.title: Oversight
categories.description: The policies, procedures, and processes are in place to govern, manage, and monitor the organization's regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements as they relate to privacy.

categories.title: Inventory and Mapping
categories.description: Systems, products, and services that process data are inventoried and data processing is mapped.

categories.title: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures
categories.description: Policies, processes, and procedures for authorizing data processing (e.g., acquisition, use) inform the organization's risk management decisions and are used to manage privacy risks.

categories.title: Data Processing Management
categories.description: Data are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect individuals' privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles.

categories.title: Disassociated Processing
categories.description: Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect individuals' privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles.

categories.title: Awareness and Training
categories.description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization's risk strategy.

categories.title: Communications Management
categories.description: Individuals and organizations are provided with effective mechanisms to communicate with the organization about data processing, and associated privacy risks are managed.

categories.title: Data Security
categories.description: Data are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect individuals' privacy and maintain data confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

categories.title: Processing
categories.description: Technical solutions are in place to process data in accordance with the organization's risk strategy to protect individuals' privacy.

subcategories.title: Systems, products, and services that process data are inventoried
Owners or operators (e.g., service providers) and other entities (e.g., data brokers, third-party application developers) involved with processing data are inventoried
Categories of individuals whose data are being processed are inventoried
Data actions of the systems, products, or services are inventoried
Purpose(s) for the data actions are inventoried
Data elements within the data actions are inventoried
The contextual factors (e.g., temporal, geographic, societal) of the data actions are identified
Data processing is mapped, illustrating the data actions and associated data elements for systems, products, or services
The organization's role(s) in the data processing ecosystem are identified and communicated (e.g., as a controller, processor, data broker, or third-party application developer)
Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated
The organization's role-related obligations for data processing by an organizational program, system, product, or service are determined and communicated
Data processing activities are established in ways that enable the organization to communicate those data actions to individuals
Privacy values, policies, and training are established and communicated
Privacy risk management activities are established, supported by resources, and reviewed and adjusted to ensure continued support throughout the organization
The organization's workforce that interacts with the data processing ecosystem is identified
Dependencies within the data processing ecosystem are established and managed
Privacy risk is identified and documented by the organization
Privacy risk associated with an organizational program, system, product, or service is determined by qualified personnel and is documented

Privacy risk assessments and other risk management tools are used to determine how organizational programs, systems, products, or services could create, sustain, or increase specific problematic data actions for individuals
Privacy risks associated with the system, product, or service are communicated to the appropriate organizational programs or departments
Privacy risk information is shared within the organization
Privacy risk is used to inform mission and business decisions
Data processing by third-party entities is assessed
Organizational privacy values and policies are established and communicated
Privacy policy is reviewed and adjusted to reflect changes in data processing practices, organizational operations, information management, and risk environment
Privacy policy and procedures are established and enforced by leadership
Risk management processes and associated roles and responsibilities are established
Privacy risk appetite, risk assumptions, and risk tolerance are established and communicated
Privacy risk management priorities are established and communicated
Privacy risk is examined and associated organizational decisions (including priorities, resource allocation, and compensating controls selection) are determined and communicated
The workforce is informed and trained on its roles and responsibilities
Senior executives are informed and trained on their roles and responsibilities
Privacy workforce and senior executives are trained on how to identify and respond to privacy-related events

Other workforce members that interact with the organization's systems, products, or services or have access to individuals' data are informed and trained on applicable privacy policies, procedures, and protocols
The workforce's privacy knowledge, skills, and abilities are periodically reviewed
Privacy governance and risk management processes are established, documented, and implemented
Privacy governance and risk management processes are aligned with other organizational strategies and processes and occur throughout the life cycle
Mechanisms for ongoing monitoring of privacy risks are implemented and findings are evaluated
Reports are generated and communicated as required to enable risk-informed decisions
Systems, products, and services that process data are inventoried (Duplicates IDENTIFY-P.IM-01)
Owners or operators (e.g., service providers) and other entities (e.g., data brokers, third-party application developers) involved with processing data are inventoried (Duplicates IDENTIFY-P.IM-02)
Processes for data acquisition are established
Processes for data use are established
Processes for data disposal are established
Data processing policies, processes, and procedures are followed and enforced
Data processing policies, processes, and procedures are reviewed and adjusted to address changes in technology and business objectives
Data elements can be accessed for review
Data elements can be accessed for transmission or disclosure
Data elements can be accessed for alteration
Data elements can be accessed for deletion
Data are processed to limit observability and linkability (e.g., data actions take place with pseudonymous data)
Data are processed to limit the identification of individuals (e.g., data actions take place with de-identified, aggregated, anonymized data)

Mechanisms (e.g., notices) for communicating data processing purposes, practices, associated privacy risks, and options for enabling individuals' data processing preferences and requests are established and in place
Mechanisms for obtaining feedback from individuals (e.g., surveys, focus groups) about data processing and associated privacy risks are established and in place
System/product/service design enables data processing visibility
Records of data disclosures and sharing are maintained and can be accessed for review or transmission/disclosure
Data corrections or deletions can be communicated to individuals or organizations (e.g., data sources) in the data processing ecosystem
Complaints, concerns, and questions from individuals about organizational data processing practices are responded to and resolved
Individuals' data processing preferences are determined and managed by the organization
Individuals' data requests are received and managed by the organization
Data are provisioned and managed throughout their lifecycle
Data are maintained securely
Access to data and systems, products, or services is managed
Data integrity is maintained
Data are protected during transmission, storage, and processing
Data destruction, erasure, and retention practices are governed by policy and performed according to requirements
Technical privacy architectures for systems, products, or services are implemented to support privacy principles
Separation of duties, principle of least privilege, and other security design principles are used to manage access to data
Data processing is controlled to allow for data to be accessed, corrected, deleted, or taken back
System/product/service design enables data to be shared in accordance with predetermined terms
System/product/service design enables individuals' data processing preferences to be expressed
System/product/service design enables individuals' data processing preferences to be implemented
System/product/service design enables the evaluation of whether data processing has complied with predetermined terms
